Reviews.Title: “Best value in the San Diego, CA area! We would stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: TrishW-ABQ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Western Inn & Suites in Old Town for 6 nights in March 2012 on our vacation to San Diego. It was more than I expected -- a quiet, clean, affordable room with courteous staff day and night, free wireless (lots of hotels are now charging). The breakfast was cold cereal and coffee, but we came not expecting a full breakfast. However, this hotel is just a couple of blocks off the main Old Town area with lots of great restaurants and within walking distance of the main transit area where we could catch a bus, train, or trolley. No need to rent a car. I would encourage families to stay in this hotel. It's a bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, and a pleasant staff!”
Reviews.Author: Budget L
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this motel in Dec of 2011. The motel was very clean and quiet which was exactly what we needed since we would be tired from going to the nearby attractions. Also it was close to Seaworld and SD Zoo... We saw that the convention center was close by and walking distance to Old Town San Diego which was pretty cool if you want to see some history. Our kids were more into Seaworld and the Zoo for obvious reasons. Overall I would recommend this place... its like staying at an expensive franchised hotel at an independent motel price. Only thing is San Diego is quite cold at night in Dec!

Reviews.Title: “Hire some cleaners”
Reviews.Author: ymak3
Reviews.Content: Thankfully we just stayed one night in this hotel. We had 2 rooms, both smelled musty. Mattresses were awful, falling apart. The door to the bathroom was filthy, both sides, the taps, sink and backsplash. The hairdryer had so much dust on the vent I couldn't use it. Very disappointing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Eric A
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I just made a trip to this wonderful city of San Diego and enjoyed our stay in Old Town. We were welcomed by the staff with great friendliness and hospitality. We booked a comfortable room with King bed and everything in the room worked just fine. The neighborhood is quiet and convenient to get around. Thank you Western Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Marine Boot Camp Graduation”
Reviews.Author: Tina S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights when our son graduated from boot camp in December 2011. The rooms weren't 5 star but we didn't go to California to sit in our hotel room. When I called for reservations the gentleman made many money saving suggestions! The staff was very helpful with restaurants and cabs. The hotel is in within walking distance of Old Town San Diego...which I fell in love with. We would definitely stay here again...just for the location and the service of the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Happy surprise”
Reviews.Author: Max C
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Western Inn, Old Town, San Diego for a week in February/2012. I had been referred to the hotel by a friend but was not aware of all the conveniences of the place. Everything went very smoothly in my stay. The hotel proved to be a good surprise of my visit to San Diego, with very comfortable facilities, good price, excellent location, and everything working properly and timely. The treatment by staff is also a plus. I highly reccomend this hotel and plan to stay there in my next visit to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Limited but clean, conveniently located and good service”
Reviews.Author: Clare C
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at this hotel for 4 nights as part of a 2 week journey through California. I found this hotel very easy to find ( we booked through Expedia) and got a decent rate for the type of hotel this was. At check in the gentleman offered us to upgrade to a slightly larger room with a microwave and refrigerator for just $10 more. Very convenient since we could heat up our milk for my 8 month year old son and store my groceries. My husband made could use of the high speed internet. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. The street is on a quiet side about 1 block of the Interstate. Everytime I walked to the lobby I was promptly greeting by the desk clerk with a genuine smile and ready to assist with helpful information. They have fresh coffee, juice and sweet rolls. Will visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Service, Price and WiFi”
Reviews.Author: drtinku1224
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a place to sleep and rest before heading out to Sea World. The Hotel proved to be much more. It was located just off the freeway and two exits from Sea World, walking distance from Old Town, and a few minutes from Gas Lamp District, Marina etc. The rooms were fairly priced and clean. The decor was a bit dated but not an eyesore. One of the pleasant surprises was WiFi; it was fast and free! Sanjay was very knowledgeable about the nearby sites and very hospitable. To park in the structure was 6 dollars but The nearby street parking is fee. We ran into some of the other staff, all of which are friendly. I highly recommend this place for couples and family who don't plan to stay in the hotel all day but need a place to stay. Free breakfast is a plus! We both loved San Diego and will be going and will most likely stay at Western Inn again. Thanks Sanjay for making our trip comfortable and memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Ode2travel
Reviews.Content: This hotel's convenience to everything in Old Town is it's biggest plus. Price is not bad either. It is a comfortable, no-frills hotel. The king-size bed was comfortable (fitted sheets didn't fit, though), the water pressure in the shower was incredible. After staying in many foreign countries I've come to appreciate this. A privacy wall outside my room made me feel a bit closed in. There is a nice balcony area with tables on the back of the hotel. I found it accidentally. Sanjay at the front desk was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: vonnielasvegas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stumbled across this place 5 years ago and have been staying ever since. For an older hotel I have no complaints. It has covered parking, which I like and is walking distance to everything including the trolly which can take you practically anywhere you want for about 4 bucks. The rooms are clean, tidy and unintrusive. WE always have a coffee pot for fresh coffee and a refrigerator if requesting one. You are provided with a continental breakfast downstairs, which includes the usual, oj, tea, several cereal brands, and muffins, enough to get your motor going before you start out on the days adventure. The staff personal are all friendly and our host, GM Mr. Sanjay is a very nice person, always ready to help, and smiling all the time. I like the hotel for all its worth, nothing too fancy, no flatscreens (ill bring that to his attention, hee, hee) but just plain nice. WE are not in the rooms for any length of time so it suits our needs perfectly. and just off the highway which is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great area for fun in San Diego.”
Reviews.Author: Gregory H
Reviews.Content: The room was okay, bed good, area great. Nice front desk staff and nice area for exploring. Lots to do around the hotel. The room was dark and forlorn but that was okay, the bed was good and it had a fridge and micro, i think. Great area, Old Town San Diego is awesome. Crazee Burger is stellar, so is Coyote Grill. Too much good food and drink makes for a good trip. Beaches are a short drive. Downtown Gaslamp is epic.

Reviews.Title: “Unprofessional and Irresponsible Staff”
Reviews.Author: RyanS_Vegas
Reviews.Content: Avoid this place. During my stay I was parked in the hotel garage in a designated space when a clay roof tile fell and severely damaged the hood of my car. The hotel staff showed a lack of concern and still has not taken responsibility for the incident. Sanjay, the GM on duty, won't even return phone calls to my insurance company. Stay anywhere but here if you decide to make Old Town your home base on your visit to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Easily overlooked great value with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: roger098
Reviews.Content: This is located right beside the Courtyard Marriot and that seems to be the best way to explain it to many of the taxi drivers. The staff is the friendliest I have seen in the area and willing to go the extra mile to help guests out when they need it. Guest laundry facilities are available. There is no shuttle from this motel and you will need to get a taxi or rental car to travel to most places but when you factor in the much lower price and the fact that the staff is so helpful, it is a small sacrifice. We highly recommend this place to first time visitors on a budget who want to be centrally located to Sea World, Balboa Park, and the harbor.

Reviews.Title: “FILTHY, SMELLS, AND SHOULD NOT BE ON TRIP ADVISOR”
Reviews.Author: follies65
Reviews.Content: IMAGINE a duumpy roadside motel off the freeway, THOSE ARE BETTER THAN THIS PLACE. The room had no screens on the windows, no decent towels, a 14 inch televison with every station in spanish, a comforter from 1960, a filty hallway with cheerios all over it, no coffee for the coffee maker. We had driven all day, I had surgery scheduled for the next day, so we stayed overnight, and left at 7:ooAM, forfeited the money. NO REFUNDS

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: mrsupercat
Reviews.Content: I had a marvelous time at the Western Inn Hotel. I experience very good customer service. The hotel was very reasonably priced too. The hotel was in walking distance to several restaurants and trolley station.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Service”
Reviews.Author: Cal3san
Reviews.Content: My stqay was very enjoyable. Staff was great since I arrived with little cash and was waiting for a replacement credit card to arrive. Took a personal check based on my passport. Stayed extra day instead of going to local military lodge. Rooms neat and clean. 2 queen beds in my room. Bathrooms clean. Indoor parking was monitored by desk for added security of my motorcycle. Walking distance to Old Town Village and resturants. Definitely will use this venue on next trip to San Diego

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Nice always smiling manager Sanjay.”
Reviews.Author: Nbjb2000
Reviews.Content: Look no further. We enjoyed visiting San Diego at least twice a year and this Hotel serves us well. Right in old town San Diego where you can just walk, relax and eat. Walking distance to the trolley that can take you all the way to the border. Manager Sanjay also have discounted Sea World tickets which is really nice and convenient. Very close to mission bay where you can take your kids, your bike or fishing rods and have a relaxing fishing trip around the bay. What more can I say when you have this hotel that always have good rates and right in the middle of everything you come to see San Diego for. Awesome.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: vegasbums
Reviews.Content: We have been coming to the Western In At Old town for quite sometime now at least 2 times a year and have found the management to be above reproach, friendly, accomendating, and always smiling. The rooms are not fancy, just very nice, clean, and quiet when we are ready to sleep. It is located in a great area so walking is easy. They provide a breakfast, coffee, cereal, just enough to get the motor running. The manager Mr Sanjay Patel is a very nice man who we have come to look forward to seeing his smile. We will keep coming to this establishment as we are always welcomed when we arrive. I definitely give the manager and hotel a thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “A deal”
Reviews.Author: SugarMountain1
Reviews.Content: The room was great, the price was good, and the staff helpful and friendly. The elevator area looks a little shabby, and the reception area isn't plush, but the location was good and the room great.

Reviews.Title: “America's Number One City”
Reviews.Author: Rick46484
Reviews.Content: Great location. Great customer service. Quiet room

Reviews.Title: “OLD TOWN SAN DIEGO!!!”
Reviews.Author: Angelino7
Reviews.Content: When we go to San Diego, we love to stay at the Western Inn, since it's conveniently located near Old Town San Diego, and is a great value. Walking distance from Old Town shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rates, and great area.”
Reviews.Author: bubbly2272
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Western Inn 3 times now. The owner is very hospitable and accommodating. Rooms have always been clean and beds are not too bad. Located right in Old Town and walking distance from the main street. Covered parking is available. The hotel accross the street from the Western Inn is more that double the price. This is not a fancy hotel by any means but I think a good value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: travelbuggyAustralia
Reviews.Content: I stayed ast Western Inn and suites for 5 nights in August 2010. Check in was smooth. Staff were friendly. I never saw housekeeping but my room was always cleaned and towels refreshed. The room was dated, but it working condition and clean. Aircon worked well and blackout blinds kept the late afternoon sun at bay. Walking distance to Old Town and the train downtown. Short drive to many different shops. Downsides are that breakfast was included but very basic. And the parking is very tight. I had a compact hire car and it was very difficult to park in the carpark. I can't imagine how hard it must have been for those with larger or normal size cars. The internet was wired and adequately fast to upload pictures/browse internet. There was a microwave and small fridge in the room which was handy. I would stay there again as the rates were very affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Nasty!”
Reviews.Author: EMA2010
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended via the accommodation board at the tourist information booth down town... The pictures were VERY misleading! The only redeeming feature of this hotel is its proximity to Old Town! The parking is tight, the building itself isnt well maintained and the rooms were basic. The bathrooms were dirty, smears on the wall... Had I noticed the Marriott across the road we would have packed up and gone there. Shame as it could be a lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Fantastic price!”
Reviews.Author: hellholesrus
Reviews.Content: The rooms are as good as any normal hotel (en suite, TV, free fast WIFI, twin Queen beds, Air con etc) Very clean and tidy, the staff couldn't be more helpful if they tried one member of staff (Mark) even had time to show us to a nearby Irish bar and sat down to a pint of guinness with us! cheers Mark. The hotel itself is simple but it was exactly what I needed, cheap, clean and friendly. Located in Old town and only a five minute walk to both the bus and trolley (tram) station. There are several places to eat and drink within a 2 minute walk, so no complaints there at all. If I return to San Diego I will definitely stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Spartan”
Reviews.Author: emmasdad2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on recommendation of family. Nice location, clean. No other good attributes. Few pwr outlets, problem for me as I trvl with a lot of technology...and one of outlets wasn't working. The vent fan in bathroom was loud and annoying...made it uncomfortable to use bathroom, woke my family if used the bathroom at night. Had a desk, but no chair to sit at desk? No brkfst, bad coffee. Lost my reservation. Overall, poor valve...won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding staff, great location at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: LSSUnurse08
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at Old Town Western Inn several times now, we continue to return for the great location and excellent, helpful staff. The rooms are always very clean, accomedations may be simple, but the hotel has all the basics you need. The hotel is walking distance to San Diego's old town. The staff is always there to help and they are very knowledgeable of the city, surrounding area, as well as nearby resturants. We wouldn't stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Sanj is very profesional to work with”
Reviews.Author: GreenValleyTuscon
Reviews.Content: Sanj was very accomodating and helpful when we arrived because the room we had prebooked was given to someone else. He made all atempts to make us happy, great kudos to him.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't recommend this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: kama_kana
Reviews.Content: The rooms did not meet our expectations. Our shower had the safety bar (for handicaps/elderly) coming out of the tile work - a safety hazard would be more like it. The carpet was not vacuumed and it smelled like mold/mildew. The beds were uncomfortable and the the sheets appeared to be clean, the comforter and flimsy blanket I couldn't comment on - they were adequate for their purpose. Continental breakfast - poor menu of cereal and mini danishes that looked old and stale.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Great value!”
Reviews.Author: landladytina
Reviews.Content: Our room was very clean and I found it spacious and bright. Olde Town itself was a really neat place to stay.. wish we had more than 1 night there, but this was supposed to be a quick stay after a vacation in Baja. The management at the Western Inn were aiming to please with recommendations for restaurants, stores, and even let us use the internet for free in the lobby to print our plane tickets. We had an issue with the airport taxi they ordered... taxi ended up being 20 minutes late and we were VERY tight on time. We made it to the airport with time to spare, but the hotel was very apologetic and refunded our taxi fee without me having to ask.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodation at the best rate we could find”
Reviews.Author: TwoTravelers28
Reviews.Content: Being budget travellers, we were very impressed with The Western Inn. At an extremely affordable rate, we were given a very clean, quiet room just a block off the main drag in Old Town San Diego. The staff was friendly and personal. They went above and beyond the call of duty to answer our questions, give us directions, and suggest places to visit and affordable restaurants to dine at. We were planning to rent a car or take a taxi, when the gentleman at the front desk suggested the San Diego Trolley just a 10 minute walk down the street. At $5 for a day pass, we managed to see all of this beautiful city without the expense of fuel and traffic. With the money we saved, we managed to extend out stay 2 extra days. This is one of the few hotels we stayed at that made you feel right at home. Hats off to Western Inn & staff. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “You can do better”
Reviews.Author: odessa712
Reviews.Content: Location is OK if you are interested in Old Towne. It is easy to take the MTS downtown or the Coaster north to Oceanside. The hotel is dated and needs to be redone. The price is good for the location,but I found you can stay at the Best Western up the street for about $35 more a night and enjoy a really nice hotel. The "free breakfast" is a joke and the wifi works only part time if you are lucky. They do keep the rooms clean, but the sheets, towels and bedding are old. Beaware that not one taxi driver knew the location of the Western Inn. Tell them is across the street form the Marriot Courtyard in Old Towne.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, Great customer service, unbeatable price”
Reviews.Author: elpako76
Reviews.Content: Wow what can I say, I only had one week one oportunity to enjoy San Diego, this was the perfect place to stay, clean rooms great customer service, centralized location, right off the freeway, when I needed directions and to get event tickets the personnel at the western inn were great and very presice , It was my pleasure to stay in such a welcoming hotel. thank you

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: aldjfahjufoi
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is the best value in Old Town. I love the location and the rooms are clean with good decor. We'll definately be staying with you again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Chooky
Reviews.Content: Great location, helpful staff and for the money......................it is very, very good value. Thank you Sanjay for making our 4 day stay so comfortable and I apologise for the Aussies beating you guys yet again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay At Western Inn & Suites”
Reviews.Author: Roshan30338
Reviews.Content: I strongly recommend Western Inn & Suites to everyone. I stayed there for one week and they have wonderful Customer Service, Rooms, cleanliness. I stayed at other hotel near that before and Western Inn is 100% better than that. My clients were really really happy who stayed with me as well. ONE OF THE BETTER HOTELS I STAYED IN. STRONGLY RECOMMENDED!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice get away”
Reviews.Author: Markst62
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice little hotel near old town state park. The staff is great and have no problem bringing you extra pillows even late at night. It is in walking distance to the park and many nice restrants, clubs, and shops. Rooms are very clean and roomy. Perfect for a weekend get away with your partner!

Reviews.Title: “ideal location for a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveller214
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Western Inn Old Town during mid summer and we found the hotel conveniently located within walking distance to the famous Old Town center and also the trolley station which was convenient as well. Great Mexican restaurants were also nearby. The rooms will satisfy your basic needs and are comfortable. There are danish, juice and fresh coffee in the morning which is nice. The staff were pleasant and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “This place needs to be fumigated. We just got there and my girls were already screaming because they saw a cockroach on”
Reviews.Author: pandabear22
Reviews.Content: Theplace needs to be fumigated. We just got there and my girls were already screaming because they saw a cockroach on the bed. There wasn't just one, I saw four. The bathroom too smelled bad, it smelled like somebody urinated on the floor. The staff are ok, and the place is just a few minutes away from Seaworld but I would rather stay at a hotel a little farther as long as it's clean and there are no cockroaches. I will not recommend this place, it was a bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “Functional on a Budget”
Reviews.Author: cloud_surfr
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for those on a budget needing to stay in Old Town. I paid half the price of the hotel next door and was within walking distance of the hotel where my conference was being held. As a female traveling alone, I felt very safe walking around the neighborhood at night. Two complaints: The room was fine although it still smelled like smoke and it was a nonsmoking room; when I told the cashier (because I had to sign a waiver saying I'd pay $150 if I smoked in the room) she looked at me annoyingly and shrugged. Overall, I had a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “More like a truckstop motel”
Reviews.Author: berlin04aa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is rated as 2.5* by Hotwire and 2* by other sites. Compared to other 2.5* in the area, this one would not be in the same scale. It is not a hotel, rather a motel, much like those truckstop ones you see in small towns. Carpets, beds and furniture are 20+ years old. Wallpaper peeling off wall and cracks and yellow stains on the ceiling. Shampoo packets and cheap soap. 2nd floor room had view of wall. No courtyard. "Free" breakfast consists of 2 choices of cereal and that's all. Not far from old town but in a very dark street. Front door is open to the outside. How can it be a 2.5* hotel if it has a "night time check inn window"? To be fair, if you are looking for a very cheap place to sleep and you don't mind a very dated room and are expecting <1*, then this is it.

Reviews.Title: “bad value for the price”
Reviews.Author: gaksei
Reviews.Content: - The room itself isn't cheap and they even ask you to pay extra for parking and room safe. - A/C in my room was broken (almost in pieces, looked as if it had been hit by a train...). I was told I got a standard room but when I changed the room for the one with working A/C it turned out that the new allegdly standard one was much better equipped than the first one (microwave and fridge) and was bigger! - The meal they serve in the morning is far from what I would call a breakfast, just a limited number of toasts and some cereals. Come early if you want to eat something cause they run out of it fast! Good location, however there are lots of other hotels in the Old Town area within the same price range, with higher level of service...

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: duckpluck
Reviews.Content: we just got back from our stay. We went for our sons Marine graduation. Location was perfect. This hotel, airport, and MCRD all very very close. We never had to stray far. A short walk to Old Town, a historic area of San Diego. We ate 3 times at a great Mexican rest called the Coyote Cafe and it was awesome. Try the Chicken Quesadilla. Its money. Also very close to a lot of other eating places within a very short drive. The staff was great at Western Inn. They helped me several times. Bed comfort wasnt the greatest but ok. I would stay there again, no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: GypsyGirl512
Reviews.Content: I was heading to San Diego for a wedding with a friend of mine. The hotel with the fully booked block of rooms was in Old Town, so we wanted to stay in that neighborhood. Most hotels were $150+ but the Western in was under $70. I checked here and it got mixed reviews but we decided to risk it. I'm very glad that we did! I requested a king bed instead of two queens and the very friendly front desk employee said they had reserved a king bed room for us. It was obvious the room was made for two queens because it was HUGE. They could have fit a table and chairs in there easily. I also didn't realize we'd have a mini-fridge and microwave. That was a nice touch. I am not super picky with cleanliness of rooms. Basically if there's no mold or bugs, I'm happy. I was happy with the room. The bed was sufficiently comfortable and the room was surprisingly quiet. I expected noise because the airport was so close but we weren't bothered by any noise in the room. The underground parking lot was a bit tight, but there was always plenty of parking. We bought discounted zoo tickets from the front desk as well. I didn't check out the breakfast. The front desk employee said it's pretty much coffee, pastries, and juice. We went down the street to "The Living Room" instead. We figured with the $80+ a day we saved by staying at the Western Inn, we could splurge on getting a $15 breakfast for two. And they offer breakfast all day. Checkout was very smooth and quick. Basically, I wouldn't stay here if it was my honeymoon or bachelorette party, but for anything else, I would certainly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: jamphipp
Reviews.Content: This place is basically a dive. The carpets are stained, the bathroom tiles are cracked, and the beds are rather worn, but the location is great. If you are looking for a cheap, safe place to sleep, then book the Western. Advice: enter and exit the parking garage through the (one way) enter lane, the exit lane will scrape your car.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for the prices”
Reviews.Author: travel1999
Reviews.Content: The services was great and the rooms were very large (large than avg hotels). Room was clean and locations was great. From the hotel you could walk to Old Town which was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: dipgit
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Western Inn located in Old Town and we enjoyed our stay very much. The services was great and the room were very large. The housekeeping did a great job during our 5 day stay at the hotel. I would recommend this hotel and I for sure will stay here when we return to San Diego in Dec.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: TulsaGal
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience with this hotel, and would definitely stay there again and recommend it to others. It is not a new hotel, but it has great amenities and is away from the heavy traffic. It is easy to find, and right across the street from a larger hotel, in a quiet part of the Old Town neighborhood area. The management was extremely helpful. The hotel is within easy walking distance of Old Town park and its many shops and restaurants, as well as a major station to catch the trolley, Coaster or buses (the public transportation is fabulous). The continental breakfast is a bit skimpy, but there are so many fine restaurants throughout San Diego, it is just as well not to overeat starting with breakfast. San Diego is a jewel, and this is a great hotel from which to base your stay.

Reviews.Title: “RUNAWAY!!!”
Reviews.Author: dgrissmer
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent writing this review on behalf of a client who was booked in this hotel by our travel agency. She said it was absolutely terrible. She said, and I quote "The hotel is in the middle of a residential area, there is no room to walk around, the hotel has no pool, the rooms were dirty, there were broken tiles on the bathroom floor, mold in the bathroom, silver fish in the room, no continental breakfast even though they advertise this on their website. The breakfast is danishes and orange juice on a table. Parking costs $6 a day, or you have to find your own parking." When my client spoke to the hotel management about the accomodations, they just shook their head and said sorry. They never offered or mentioned any kind of reimbursement. Bad customer service, bad rooms, bad hotel. RUNAWAY!!! Our agency will never book this hotel again. We were told that there is a Best Western Hacienda 3 blocks from this location that is much nicer. We recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap is as cheap does”
Reviews.Author: NoEndo
Reviews.Content: The good news is the proximity to Old Town. The bad news is the noise level from within the building...even though the nearby airport adds it's own overtones. The noise from within is the plumbing system...it virtually howls from the bowels. Late arriving guests taking a shower will give you a start like you've never known. The other issue was a phone system that didn't work while we were there. Parking in the building is $5/ day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: glynndak
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the Western Inn and Suites this past weekend. Since there were 3 of us, our original reservation was just a standard room. I asked if there were any suites available and could we be upgraded...the afternoon desk clerk, SANJAY, was very friendly and helpful and did have a suite available. He quickly upgraded us, as well as giving us a coupon for free appitizers for a local resturant. Our suite was a corner suite, very spacious and nice. One member of our party stayed on the pullout couch and said it was very comfortable. Sue, another desk clerk was very friendly and was able to print our airline boarding pass. What great and friendly service. For the budget conscious traveler, this hotel is ideal. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Us....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Western Inn Old Town - Arista St. Old Town San Diego I'm writing this review from the room; we've just completed a four day stay and will leave in the morning. The room -- 3rd (top) floor with a queen size bed -- was VERY large. Shower water pressure was excellent. Our room included a refrigerator, microwave & small coffee pot. The staff kept the room clean, refreshed our towels and provided coffee supplies. The hotel is located in the lower section of Old Town which makes it within walking distance of the main streets. There is no street traffic to wake you in the middle of the night. The trolley station is nearby which we made use of to travel to the Gaslight section for dinner one night. The price was very very reasonable -- under $90. I would definitely recommend and would stay here again. Be advised, the building is older and there is nothing elegant about the small lobby or the outside hallways. We opted for our coffee in-room and skipped the continental breakfast which only consisted of coffee, juice & muffins.

Reviews.Title: “Really Gross”
Reviews.Author: Firefly44
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at this hotel, we were immediately aware of the mistake we had made in booking this hotel sight unseen. The parking alone, was difficult due to such a small underground area with concrete poles -- not at all friendly to mid-size or larger vehicles. The "street person" picking through the garbage as we walked in, was not exactly what I wanted to see either. The room we booked was a suite -- and was fairly large....yet very BARE. Not only was there artwork missing off the walls, the smoke dectector was in a drawer (with a hole in the ceiling with wires hanging down). There was no ambience, to say the least. The pull-out couch had dirty linens, the bathroom had hair all over the floor and there were several light bulbs that were not working. The staff apologized and told us to write a letter to the hotel manager (after they cleaned the bed and bath). Since this was a holiday weekend, the manager was not available to discuss. While this hotel has a great location, with ease of walking into Old Town, I certainly question why they would let this place get this rundown and unattractive. Their neighbors (LaQuinta and the Marriott) probably don't mind, but the Western Management should!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for a hotel on a budget :)”
Reviews.Author: emilie999
Reviews.Content: I stayed there 6 nights in January. The hotel is ideally located in the old Town where it is very safe even late at night. It is also 10 minutes drive from the airport and just 5 minutes walk from the bus and the trolley transit station at Old town. The room are quite big and clean. The breakfast is okay. The staff is friendly especially the day receptionnist named SANJAY who i am really grateful to as he really did his best to answer all my questions during my stay and they were numerous. Definitely whenever i will return to San Diego i will stay at this hotel. Emilie VIDAL

Reviews.Title: “Old Town Western Inn & Suites a Downer”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I reserved two rooms at the Old Town Western Inn online. On arrival, one of the non-smoking rooms had a pungent "old" odor. On closer inspection, we discovered the phone cord cut, a shade missing from the bedside light, and an unused condom on the smoke detector, apparently to block the sensor. A wake up call that was requested didn't get made. In the other room, items were missing such as the coffee maker and the bedside light bulb. Thin walls and noise after midnight was an issue as well. It also was disappointing that management did not extend an apology to us in any form.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We came over from England and had reservations at a property in Old Town when we got to the hotel the hotel was sold out and had given our room away they sent us to the Western Inn for one night and told us to come the next day for 2 more days. When we got to the Western Inn they new what happen and handle the situations very well, the next day we told the front desk that we wanted to stay here instead of going to the hotel we had made reserations for, the young lady at the front desk told us that we would need to cancel the reserations at the other hotel first, which we did. The hotel had everything we needed the only diffences it did not have a eating place and we did not need that because we were staying in Old Town. The staff were great and also the rate was around about $20 US lower.

HotelInfo.Name: Western Inn & Suites
HotelInfo.Address: 3889 Arista Street, San Diego, CA 92110
